Questions: A uniform magnetic field, B = 3.0 G, exists in the +x-direction. A proton (q = +e) shoots through the field in the +y-direction with a speed of 5.0 × 10⁶ m/s. (a) Find the magnitude and direction of the force on the proton. (b) Repeat with the proton replaced by an electron.
solution: (a) F = qvB sin θ = (1.6 × 10⁻¹⁹ C)(5.0 × 10⁶ m/s)(3.0 × 10⁻⁴ T) = 2.4 × 10⁻¹⁶ N, direction: –z. (b) Same magnitude, direction reversed: +z.

Questions: Describe the path followed by a proton moving perpendicular to a uniform magnetic field of 30 G directed out of the page with speed 5.0 × 10⁶ m/s.
solution: The proton follows a circular path. Radius r = mv/qB = 1.7 m.

Questions: A proton enters a magnetic field of flux density 1.5 Wb/m² with a velocity of 2.0 × 10⁷ m/s at an angle of 30°. Compute the force on the proton.
solution: F = qvB sin(30°) = 2.4 × 10⁻¹² N.

Questions: An electron beam is bent in a circle of radius 2.0 cm by a uniform magnetic field B = 4.5 × 10⁻³ T. What is the speed of the electrons?
solution: v = r q B / m = 1.6 × 10⁴ km/s.

Questions: A charged particle enters a region with E = 80 kV/m and B = 0.4 T. What speed must it have to pass undeflected?
A proton is shot with speed 8.0 × 10⁶ m/s at 30° to a magnetic field B = 0.15 T in the x-direction. Describe the path followed.
solution: Spiral motion: v₁ = 6.93 × 10⁶ m/s; radius = 0.28 m; pitch = 3.0 m.

Questions: Alpha particles (q = +2e) accelerated by 1.0 kV enter a B = 0.20 T field. Find the radius of their path.
A wire with B = 0.80 T and I = 30 A experiences a force. Find the magnitude and direction of the force on a 5.0 cm length of wire.
solution: ΔF = I(ΔL)B sin θ = (30 A)(0.050 m)(0.80 T) = 1.2 N, downward.

Questions: A wire loop carries current I and is perpendicular to a magnetic field B. What are the resultant force and torque?
solution: Net force = 0. Torque τ = NIAB sin θ = 0 since θ = 0°.

Questions: A 40-turn coil (2.0 A, B = 0.25 T) has dimensions 10 cm × 12 cm. Find the torque and direction of rotation.
solution: τ = NIAB sin θ = 0.24 N·m, coil rotates so side ad moves out of the page.

Questions: A quarter loop of radius 5.0 cm carries 14 A. A 300 G magnetic field points in +x. Find torque and direction.
solution: τ = NIAB sin θ = 2.9 × 10⁻³ N·m, loop rotates about y-axis.

Questions: Two electrons move at 5.0 × 10⁶ m/s in a magnetic field. One curves in a circle, the other moves straight. Find magnitude and direction of B.
solution: B = mv/qr = 3.6 × 10⁻⁴ T, direction = –y.

Questions: The Earth's magnetic field (5.0 × 10⁻⁵ T, 40° below horizontal) acts on a wire carrying 30 A north. Find force per meter.
solution: F/L = (30 A)(5.0 × 10⁻⁵ T) sin(40°) = 9.6 × 10⁻⁴ N, into page (west).

Questions: An ion (q = +2e) enters a magnetic field of 1.2 Wb/m² at a velocity of 2.5 × 10⁵ m/s perpendicular to the field. Determine the force on the ion.
solution: Ans. 9.6 × 10⁻¹⁴ N

Questions: Calculate the speed of ions that pass undeflected through crossed E and B fields for which E = 7.7 kV/m and B = 0.14 T.
solution: Ans. 55 km/s

Questions: The particle shown in Fig. 30-14 is positively charged in all three cases. What is the direction of the force on it due to the magnetic field? Give its magnitude in terms of B, q, and v.
solution: Ans. (a) into page, qvB; (b) out of page, qvB sin θ; (c) in plane of page at angle θ + 90°, qvB

Questions: What might be the mass of a positive ion that is moving at 1.0 × 10⁷ m/s and is bent into a circular path of radius 1.55 m by a magnetic field of 0.134 Wb/m²?
solution: Ans. n(3.3 × 10⁻²⁷ kg), where n is the ion’s charge

Questions: An electron is accelerated from rest through a potential difference of 3750 V. It enters a region where B = 4.0 × 10⁻³ T perpendicular to its velocity. Calculate the radius of the path it will follow.
solution: Ans. 5.2 cm

Questions: An electron is shot with speed 5.0 × 10⁶ m/s out from the origin. Its velocity makes a 20° angle with the +x-axis. Describe its motion in a magnetic field B = 2.0 mT in the +x-direction.
solution: Ans. Helix; r = 0.49 cm, pitch = 8.5 cm

Questions: A beam of electrons passes undeflected through mutually perpendicular electric and magnetic fields. The electric field is then removed, and electrons move in the magnetic field in a circular path of radius 1.14 cm. Find the ratio of the electronic charge to mass.
solution: Ans. e/m = 175 GC/kg

Questions: A straight wire 15 cm long, carrying 6.0 A, is in a uniform field of 0.40 T. What is the force on the wire when it is (a) perpendicular and (b) at 30° to the field?
What is the direction of the force, due to Earth’s magnetic field, on a wire carrying 6.0 A vertically downward?
solution: Ans. Horizontally toward east

Questions: Find the force on each segment of the wire shown in Fig. 30-15 if B = 0.15 T. Assume current in the wire to be 5.0 A.
solution: Ans. AB and DE: zero; BC: 0.12 N out of page; CD: 0.12 N into page

Questions: A coil of 25 loops is suspended in a 0.20 Wb/m² field. Dimensions: 15 cm × 12 cm. What current produces a torque of 5.4 N·m?
solution: Ans. 60 A

Questions: An electron is accelerated from rest through a potential difference of 800 V, then moves perpendicularly to a 30 G field. Find orbit radius and frequency.
solution: Ans. r = 3.2 cm, f = 84 MHz

Questions: A proton and a deuteron are both accelerated through the same potential difference into a magnetic field. If the proton follows a path of radius Rp, what will be the deuteron’s path radius?
solution: Ans. Rd = Rp√2
